content: Act as a helpful AI assistant
In Julia, Write a function `keep_only_names` which iterates over the provided list of words (`words`) and removes all words that do not start with a capital letter (eg, remove "dog" but keep "Dog").

Sure! Here's how you can implement this in Julia:

```julia
function keep_only_names(words)
    return filter(x -> isuppercase(first(x)), words)
end
```

This function uses the built-in `filter` function of Julia which applies a predicate (a boolean function) to every element in an array. The predicate `isuppercase(first(x))` checks if the first character of a string `x` is uppercase. This will only be true for strings that start with a capital letter.

You can use this function like so:
```julia
words = ["Dog", "cat", "Cat", "Dogg", "DOG"]
filtered_words = keep_only_names(words)
println(filtered_words)
```
This will print `["Dog", "Cat", "DOG"]`.
